Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='BGDR99')

BibliographicData.Title: Medial prefrontal cortices are unified by common connections with superior temporal cortices and distinguished by input from memory-related areas in the rhesus monkey

BrainSite.FullName: dorsomedial temporal pole (agranular and dysgranular cortex)
temporal visual association area in the lower bank of the superior temporal sulcus

Reference.Quotation: " Intact axons in the white matter are not thought to take up HRP, though there is less information about fluorescent dyes in this regard (La Vail, 1975; Meaulam, 1982). In one of these cases (case AIb), with an injection in area 24 and the caudal part of area 32, the dye spread to the adjacent tip of the corpus callosum.In case AP, with an injection in the frontal pole in area 10, the needle mark extended to the adjacent white matter. In case AKr, a small injection of rhodamine labeled microspheres in medial area 9 was restricted to cortical layers 1-5. Cases AP and AKr were used for general observations but are not included in the quantitative analyses. In the rest of the cases, the needle marks and the core of the injection sites were restricted to the cortical mantle." (pp. 353-354)

TracerSubstance.FullName: Horseradish peroxidase, conjugated to wheat germ agglutinin

Reference.Quotation: " Intact axons in the white matter are not thought to take up HRP, though there is less information about fluorescent dyes in this regard (La Vail, 1975; Meaulam, 1982). In one of these cases (case AIb), with an injection in area 24 and the caudal part of area 32, the dye spread to the adjacent tip of the corpus callosum.In case AP, with an injection in the frontal pole in area 10, the needle mark extended to the adjacent white matter. In case AKr, a small injection of rhodamine labeled microspheres in medial area 9 was restricted to cortical layers 1-5. Cases AP and AKr were used for general observations but are not included in the quantitative analyses. In the rest of the cases, the needle marks and the core of the injection sites were restricted to the cortical mantle." (pp. 353-354)

" Intact axons in the white matter are not thought to take up HRP, though there is less information about fluorescent dyes in this regard (La Vail, 1975; Meaulam, 1982). In one of these cases (case AIb), with an injection in area 24 and the caudal part of area 32, the dye spread to the adjacent tip of the corpus callosum. In case AP, with an injection in the frontal pole in area 10, the needle mark extended to the adjacent white matter. In case AKr, a small injection of rhodamine labeled microspheres in medial area 9 was restricted to cortical layers 1-5. Cases AP and AKr were used for general observations but are not included in the quantitative analyses. In the rest of the cases, the needle marks and the core of the injection sites were restricted to the cortical mantle." (pp. 353-354)
